14 June 2009

The Lord’s Day in The Valley of Vision

by Aaron Lord

“Lord’s Day Eve”

<div class="hangingindent" style="font-variant:small-caps;">God of the passing hour,
</div><div class="hangingindent">Another week has gone and I have been preserved
in my going out,
in my coming in.</div><div class="hangingindent">Thine has been the vigilance that has turned
threatened evils aside;</div><div class="hangingindent">Thine the supplies that have nourished me;</div>Thine the comforts that have indulged me;
<div class="hangingindent">Thine the relations and friends that have
delighted me;</div>Thine the means of grace which have edified me;
<div class="hangingindent">Thine the Book, which, amidst all my enjoyments,
has told me that this is not my rest,
<div class="hangingindent">that in all successes one thing alone is needful,
to love my Savior</div></div><div class="hangingindent">Nothing can equal the number of thy mercies
but my imperfections and sins.</div><div class="hangingindent">These, O God, I will neither conceal nor palliate,
but confess with a broken heart.</div><div class="hangingindent">In what condition would secret reviews
of my life leave me
<div class="hangingindent">were it not for the assurance that with thee
there is plenteous redemption,
that thou art a forgiving God,
that thou mayest be feared!</div></div><div class="hangingindent">While I hope for pardon through the blood
of the cross,
<div class="hangingindent">I pray to be clothed with humility,
to be quickened in thy way,
to be more devoted to thee,
to keep the end of my life in view,
to be cured of the folly of delay and indecision,
to know how frail I am,
<div class="hangingindent">to number my days and apply my heart
unto wisdom.</div>
